question: Adam teaches 50 students a year. How many students will Adam teach in 10 years if in the first year he only teaches 40 students?
solution:
Adam will teach 50 * 9 = <<50*9=450>>450 students in 9 years.
So, in 10 year Adam will teach 450 + 40 = <<450+40=490>>490 students.
#### 490
clean_solution:
Adam will teach 50 * 9 = 450 students in 9 years.
So, in 10 year Adam will teach 450 + 40 = 490 students.
perturbed_solution:
Adam will teach 50 * 9 = 450 students in 9 years.
So, in 10 year Adam will teach 450 + 40 = 406 students.
completed_solution_perturbed:
The partial solution has a small error in the final addition. Let's correct and complete it:

Adam teaches 40 students in the first year.
For the next 9 years, he teaches 50 students each year: 50 * 9 = 450 students.
So, in 10 years, Adam will teach 450 + 40 = 490 students.

#### 490
